intro: Grastidium ochroleucum, commonly known as the yellow-leaved stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Grastidium ochroleucum is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
